title: Question about how to specify arguments to qmake in spack
body:
Hi all,

I'm trying to add a new package, cbtf-argonavis-gui, which requires a qmake line that creates the Makefile.  The code in def install currently looks like this:
```python
    def install(self, spec, prefix):
        options = ['-o Makefile openss-gui.pro']
        qmake = which('qmake')
        qmake(*options)
        #qmake('-o Makefile openss-gui.pro')
        make()
        make("install")
```

When ever I try to build, it appears that qmake doesn't think there is an option -o Makefile openss-gui.pro.   However, I can do that command outside of spack.   So, I'm wondering if anyone can spot what I'm doing wrong.   Here is the output from spack:
```
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/home/jeg/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora19-x86_64/gcc-4.8.3/qt-5.9.1-jqgklthpzv3yktdnjftatzwaibs4vazx/bin/qmake' '-o Makefile openss-gui.pro'
/home/jeg/spack/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/cbtf-argonavis-gui/package.py:93, in install:
     89       def install(self, spec, prefix):
     90   
     91           options = ['-o Makefile openss-gui.pro']
     92           qmake = which('qmake')
  >> 93           qmake(*options)
     94           #qmake('-o Makefile openss-gui.pro')
     95           make()
     96           make("install")

See build log for details:
  /tmp/jeg/spack-stage/spack-stage-3Garsy/cbtf-argonavis-gui/spack-build.out
[jeg@localhost packages]$ cat /tmp/jeg/spack-stage/spack-stage-3Garsy/cbtf-argonavis-gui/spack-build.out
==> '/home/jeg/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora19-x86_64/gcc-4.8.3/qt-5.9.1-jqgklthpzv3yktdnjftatzwaibs4vazx/bin/qmake' '-o Makefile openss-gui.pro'
*****Unknown option -o Makefile openss-gui.pro**
Usage: /home/jeg/spack/opt/spack/linux-fedora19-x86_64/gcc-4.8.3/qt-5.9.1-jqgklthpzv3yktdnjftatzwaibs4vazx/bin/qmake [mode] [options] [files]
```

This is my full cbtf-argonavis-gui/package.py file:
```python
[jeg@localhost packages]$ cat cbtf-argonavis-gui/package.py
<header text removed>
from spack import *
class CbtfArgonavisGui(Package):
    """CBTF Argo Navis GUI project contains the GUI that views CUDA performance
       information.

    """
    homepage = "http://sourceforge.net/p/cbtf/wiki/Home/"
    # Mirror access template example
    url = "file:/home/jeg/cbtf-argonavis-gui-0.8.1.tar.gz"
    version('0.8.1', '9bdbffcc9259875bca80e2bc3a660cc7')
    #version('0.8.1', branch='master',
    #        git='https://github.com/OpenSpeedShop/cbtf-argonavis-gui.git')

    depends_on("cmake@3.0.2", type='build')
    depends_on("openspeedshop+noqt3gui")
    depends_on('qt@4.8.6:')
    depends_on("boost@1.50.0:1.59.0")
    depends_on("cbtf")
    depends_on("cbtf-krell")
    depends_on("cbtf-argonavis")
    depends_on("cuda")
    depends_on("mrnet@5.0.1:+lwthreads", when='+cbtf')
    depends_on("xerces-c@3.1.1:")
    depends_on("graphviz")
    depends_on("QtGraph")
    parallel = False

    def setup_environment(self, spack_env, run_env):
        """Set up the compile and runtime environments for a package."""
        spack_env.set('BOOSTROOT', self.spec['boost'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('CBTF_ROOT', self.spec['cbtf'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('CBTF_KRELL_ROOT', self.spec['cbtf-krell'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('CBTF_ARGONAVIS_ROOT', self.spec['cbtf-argonavis'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('OSS_CBTF_ROOT', self.spec['openspeedshop'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('GRAPHVIZ_ROOT', self.spec['graphviz'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('QTGRAPHLIB_ROOT', self.spec['QtGraph'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('KRELL_ROOT_MRNET', self.spec['mrnet'].prefix)
        spack_env.set('KRELL_ROOT_XERCES', self.spec['xerces-c'].prefix)
        #spack_env.set('QTDIR', self.spec['qt'].prefix)

    def install(self, spec, prefix):
        options = ['-o Makefile openss-gui.pro']
        qmake = which('qmake')
        qmake(*options)
        #qmake('-o Makefile openss-gui.pro')
        make()
        make("install")
```
